a) where? b) I try to install ubuntu to Dell PE1950, it has RAID (needs megaraid something, which is not included in 6.06.1) and it needs bnx2 network driver (not included in 6.06.1)

harriv: For raid you'll need the alternate install cd found on http://releases.ubuntu.com/6.06.1/ubuntu-6.06.1-alternate-i386.iso (for x86 platforms) and the bnx2 driver is indeed included in 6.06.1. However if you do insist on using 6.06 you can find the releases on http://releases.ubuntu.com/6.06/
this is related: https://features.launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+spec/dell-server-improvement
Ok, I need to try the alternative install. However the standard installation doesn't recognize Broadcom network interfaces
The link you gave includes 6.06.1

harriv: It would appear so. However on the alternate install you can manually load drivers that are not recognized correctly. You can also load the driver on the live cd using: sudo modprobe <drivername> in a terminal and then set it up with something like sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart (provided that the /etc/network/interfaces file is set up correctly even if there is not detected a network interface at boot)
